body_html:
I will second this request. This will be particularly useful for NLP researchers.

In addition, what is the most efficient way to pad a 1D tensor in Pytorch, apart from manually concatenating a zero tensor to it? The built-in torch.nn.functional.pad() function does not seem to work for 1D tensors.

body:
I will second this request. This will be particularly useful for NLP researchers.

In addition, what is the most efficient way to pad a 1D tensor in Pytorch, apart from manually concatenating a zero tensor to it? The built-in `torch.nn.functional.pad()` function does not seem to work for 1D tensors.
